result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Prosecutor.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lindsay April Weisbrod in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Lindsay April Weisbrod. 
Cases heard at this time are 21CF-513, 22CF-1, 22CF-22 and 22CF-216. 

Court calls cases.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Matters are set for a waived preliminary hearing.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Adjourned Pretrial Conference (doesnt show online) scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Day Report Program Status Report - Condition of Bond. Filed by JusticePoint - C Amundson.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued is continued in 22CF216.
22CF22 and 22CF1 bond is continued.
21CF513 bond is continued. 
Defendant can be released from custody on the determination of her being competent.

9:49 AM Defendant Lindsay April Weisbrod in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of DA Louis John Molepske Jr. for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Lindsay April Weisbrod. 
Cases heard today are 22CF1, 22CF22 and 21CF513.
One additional case added 22CF216.

Atty Anne Renc calls the cases and states the appearances.
This is set for a Status Hearing.
Court had previously ordered a competency evaluation and had been filed on June 7, 2022.
Evaluator states that the defendant has been determined to be able to proceed.
Defendant is in agreement with the findings showing she is competent.
State does not plan on contesting the competency.
Neither party has an issue with the Court using the findings of the evaluator to determine the defendant competent.
Court questions the prosecution in these matters.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is competent.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Status Report from JusticePoint dated 01/21/22
Initial Appearance set for January 24, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1
Observe all conditions of open bonds.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Vehicle Flee/Elude Officer, Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer, Threats to a Law Enforcement Officer,  Bail Jumping. 
Atty Renc states she was not able to determine if she is eligible for a public defender. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,000 bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Renc raises competency to proceed at this time. 
Court questions Atty Renc. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  01/03/2022  @  1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
